text:
# About Moez Dbira

## Professional Summary
Moez Dbira is a full-stack Data Scientist and Data Engineer with 3+ years of professional experience. He specializes in building scalable data pipelines, optimizing SQL queries, and deploying modern data stacks. His expertise spans the full data lifecycle: from raw data ingestion and feature engineering to machine learning modeling, deployment, and monitoring. With a strong background in both **Data Engineering** and **Machine Learning**, Moez bridges the gap between infrastructure and AI innovation.

## Professional Experience
- **Data Engineer at Schneider Electric (Dec 2021 – Present)**  
  - Led the development and automation of a Python-based ETL engine.  
  - Optimized SQL queries on Amazon Redshift, improving performance and efficiency.  
  - Introduced monitoring dashboards for data quality and system performance.  
  - Drove the migration to a modern dbt + Airflow stack.  
  - Experience with Git, Docker, and Kubernetes for DevOps workflows.  
  - Led the development of a Python ETL application and optimized SQL queries on Redshift, cutting execution time by 50%.  
  - Designed data warehousing architectures ensuring incremental updates and high availability of 2TB+ of records.  
  - Built Tableau dashboards to monitor ETL applications, reducing failures from 2/day to <1/month.  
  - Automated file transfer workflows with Informatica Cloud, reducing multi-day manual workloads to 1 hour.


### Data Scientist Intern — Generix Group (May 2021 – Nov 2021)
    - Built a PoC computer vision model for parcel counting on pallets using OpenCV.  
    - Designed an asynchronous API with FastAPI, Celery, and Redis.  
    - Applied reinforcement learning with Keras to optimize truck load distribution, cutting transport costs by 15%.

### Data Scientist Intern — Virtuo Technologies (Mar 2020 – Aug 2020)
    - Enhanced demand forecasting models by automating retraining pipelines with Python, improving accuracy by 5%.  
    - Optimized a car supply allocation model in R, reducing computation time by 5 hours and improving fleet responsiveness.

### Data Scientist/Engineer Intern — Generix Group (Jul 2019 – Jan 2020)
    - Built a Python ETL pipeline extracting from S3, calculating 100+ KPIs, and loading into Redshift for Quicksight dashboards.  
    - Applied SARIMAX forecasting to warehouse workloads, reducing seasonal workforce costs by 20%.


## Projects
- **Nutrition Tracking Assistant with RAG & Computer Vision**  
  Full-stack assistant combining retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) for text queries with computer vision for calorie estimation. Features include user authentication, personalized profiles, and GPU-optimized inference.  

- **Fan-Engage: Football Analytics**  
  End-to-end football analytics pipeline using YOLOv8 for detection, team assignment, pitch homography, and visualization of football metrics (possession, control zones, momentum).  

- **Time Series Forecasting for iPhone Sales**  
  Built a forecasting system using LightGBM, XGBoost, and Prophet. Incorporated business features such as product age, promotions, and contract cycles.
title: About Moez Dbira

text:
Achieved strong predictive performance (MAPE ~0.8).  

- **Football Performance Analytics from Social Media**  
  Designed an ETL pipeline correlating Bundesliga player match ratings with Twitter sentiment. Data stored in HDFS and MongoDB/PostgreSQL; insights delivered via Tableau dashboards.  

- **Churn Risk Scoring Service**  
  Developed and deployed a churn prediction model using LightGBM, integrated into FastAPI, and containerized with Docker for reproducibility.  

## Education
- **CentraleSupélec (2017 – 2021)**  
  Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, with coursework in ML, Deep Learning, Optimization, and Data Engineering.  

## Skills
- **Programming Languages**: Python (Pytest, FastAPI, Celery), SQL (PostgreSQL, Redshift, SQLite), R, JavaScript (React, Next.js), Bash.  
- **ML/AI Frameworks**: Scikit-learn, LightGBM, XGBoost, Prophet, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face Transformers, YOLOv8, OpenCV, MediaPipe, Reinforcement Learning.  
- **Data Engineering / MLOps**: Pandas, NumPy, dbt, Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes, Redis, RQ, MLflow, ONNX, GitHub Actions.  
- **Visualization**: Tableau, Quicksight, Plotly, Matplotlib, Grafana, Prometheus, Streamlit.  
- **Cloud & Storage**: AWS (S3, RDS, Redshift, Lambda), MinIO, HDFS.  
- **Tools**: Git, Jira, Confluence, Agile/Scrum, VS Code, PyCharm, Jupyter.  
- **Soft Skills**: Communication, teamwork, adaptability, problem-solving, knowledge transfer.  

## Interests & Extracurriculars
- Interests: Football, tennis, manga, music, and travel.  
- VP Voyage at Bureau des Internationaux (BdI), CentraleSupélec – responsible for organizing student trips and cultural events.  
- Co-founder of the first student association at Lycée Pilote de Gabès.  
- Contributor to the organization of two TEDx events in Gabès.  

## Languages
- French (bilingual), English (professional), Arabic (native), German (basic).
title: About Moez Dbira

text: Earned a Master's degree with specialization in Data Science and Engineering. Coursework included machine learning, statistical modeling, big data systems, and advanced software engineering. Actively involved in international student associations and event organization.
title: Master's Degree in Data Science & Engineering

text: Completed preparatory classes for the highly competitive French national entrance exams into top engineering schools. Ranked in the top 1% of students nationwide.
title: Preparatory Classes (Mathematics & Physics)
institution: Institut Préparatoire aux Etudes Scientifiques et Techniques (IPEST)

text: Earned a Baccalauréat in Mathematics with distinction, ranking among the top 0.1% nationwide.
title: Baccalauréat in Mathematics

text: Led developments of a Python ETL application and optimized SQL queries on Redshift, improving execution time by more than 50%. Designed data warehousing architectures ensuring incremental updates and high availability of over 2TB of records. Built Tableau dashboards to monitor ETL applications, lowering failures from 2 per day to less than 1 per month. Automated file transfer workflows with Informatica Cloud, reducing multi-day manual workloads to under 1 hour of automated execution.
title: Data Engineer

text: Explored computer vision applications to count parcels on pallets using OpenCV. Developed an asynchronous API with FastAPI, Celery, and Redis to optimize truck load distribution with heuristics and reinforcement learning (Keras), reducing transportation costs by 15%.
title: Data Scientist Intern

text: Enhanced demand forecasting models by automating retraining and fine-tuning with Python, boosting accuracy by 5%. Optimized an SGD-based car supply allocation model in R, reducing computation time by 5 hours and improving responsiveness for fleet management.
title: Data Scientist Intern

text: Developed a Python ETL pipeline to extract data from S3, calculate over 100 KPIs, and load results into Redshift, visualized through Quicksight dashboards. Applied SARIMAX forecasting to warehouse workloads, cutting seasonal workforce costs by 20%.
title: Data Scientist/Engineer Intern

text: Passionate about football, tennis, mangas, music, and travel.
title: Sports & Cultural Interests

text: Served as VP for travel organization at the Bureau des Internationaux, coordinating trips and cultural exchanges for international students.
title: Vice President – Bureau des Internationaux (BdI)
achievements: Organized international trips and cultural activities

text: Co-founded the first student association at Lycée Pilote de Gabès, fostering collaboration and extracurricular engagement among students.
title: Co-Founder of Student Association
achievements: Launched first-ever student association at the school

text: Contributed to the organization of two TEDx talks in Gabès, supporting event logistics and speaker coordination.
title: TEDx Gabès Organizer
achievements: Helped organize two TEDx talks in Gabès

text: Developed a full-stack assistant that combines retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) for text-based queries with computer vision for calorie estimation. Implemented user authentication, personalized profiles, and a unified /chat endpoint with intent detection. Optimized inference for GPU deployment and added real-time monitoring dashboards with Grafana and Prometheus.
title: Nutrition Tracking Assistant with RAG & Computer Vision

text: Built an end-to-end football analytics pipeline for video-based match analysis. Integrated YOLOv8 for player and ball detection, pitch homography, and team assignment. Delivered visualizations of key football metrics such as possession, territory control, and momentum. Designed a multi-repo system with FastAPI, Next.js, Redis/RQ, Docker, PostgreSQL, and MinIO.
title: Fan-Engage: Football Analytics

text: Developed a time series forecasting system to predict weekly iPhone sales per model. Engineered features including product age, discount rate, and contract cycles to reflect business dynamics. Trained and compared LightGBM, XGBoost, and Prophet models, achieving a MAPE of ~0.8 with LightGBM. Provided insights to support inventory planning and promotional strategies.
title: Time Series Forecasting for iPhone Sales

text: Built an ETL pipeline to correlate Bundesliga football players’ match ratings with Twitter sentiment. Ingested match and social media data via APIs, processed it through batch pipelines for sentiment analysis, and stored results in an HDFS-based data lake. Data was loaded into MongoDB and PostgreSQL for analysis and delivered via interactive Tableau dashboards.
title: Football Performance Analytics from Social Media

text: Developed an end-to-end churn prediction system to identify customers likely to leave. Preprocessed data using OneHotEncoder and trained a LightGBM model. Serialized the model and encoder with Joblib, and deployed them as a FastAPI REST API. Containerized the solution with Docker for scalability and integration into external systems.
title: Churn Risk Scoring Service

text: Designed a recommendation system for mobile gaming app advertisements using state-of-the-art matrix factorization techniques inspired by recent research. Analyzed user retention and funnel behavior (ad click → app download → initial usage → long-term engagement). Enhanced recommendation quality by integrating lifetime value (LTV) prediction to optimize ad targeting for both engagement and monetization.
title: Recommendation System for Gaming Apps Ads

text: Developed a real-time eye gaze tracking system that detects and projects gaze coordinates on screen from webcam video feed. Built specifically for cognitive games designed to help children with ADHD improve focus and attention. Implemented the L2CSNet (Learning to Calibrate and Segment for Gaze estimation) model for accurate gaze estimation, combined with computer vision algorithms for eye detection, pupil tracking, and calibration routines. Created a responsive interface that adapts game difficulty based on attention metrics and gaze patterns derived from the deep learning model.
title: Real-time Eye Gaze Tracking for ADHD Cognitive Games

text: Designed a web application for long-distance monitoring and management of a greenhouse. The solution focused on supporting sustainable agriculture practices by enabling remote oversight of crop growth and resource optimization.
title: A la Bonne Ferme – Smart Greenhouse Management

text: Developed an Arduino-based prototype to assist visually impaired individuals with autonomous shopping in supermarkets. The system integrated a barcode scanner (douchette à code à barre) that reads product barcodes and uses text-to-speech to announce the product name and description. Combined with ultrasonic sensors for navigation guidance and RFID technology for location awareness. Focused on hardware integration, embedded programming, and audio feedback systems rather than image processing.
title: Assistive Shopping System for the Visually Impaired

text: Built an Arduino-based prototype of an autonomous vehicle for household waste collection. Designed as part of the Intel Science Competition Arab World (ISC-AW), the system aimed to address urban waste management challenges.
title: Automatic Waste Collection Vehicle

text: Conducted a study and built a prototype of a solar electricity production system based on solar ray condensation using a parabolic mirror. The project explored renewable energy alternatives with a focus on sustainable power generation.
title: Solar Energy System with Parabolic Mirror
